page.title: 20MONZIE JOINERY
page.content: Monzie Joinery presently employs thirteen people, two of whom live on the estate itself, six in Crieff and the rest elsewhere locally. The water supply and hydro-electric power for the joinery are both supplied by the estates own resources of them. The woods used are Baltic pine from Scandinavia, American red oak from the U.S.A. and mahogany from the Tropics. The products turned out in the joinery are mainly kitchen units, computer wokstations and the wood preservative butinox. The produce is distributed throughout Scotland with very little of it being exported abroad.
